thread.title: Sheffield Wednesday 3-0 Birmingham City: Rhodes and Winnall net first Owls goals in comfortable win
thread.title_full: Sheffield Wednesday 3-0 Birmingham City: Rhodes and Winnall net first Owls goals in comfortable win

author: mirror
title: Sheffield Wednesday 3-0 Birmingham City: Rhodes and Winnall net first Owls goals in comfortable win
text:
Jordan Rhodes scored the opener for Sheffield Wednesday in their win over Birmingham (Photo: Rex Features) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jordan Rhodes’ home debut ended in predictable fashion as the prolific Championship marksman kicked off a win that breathed life into Sheffield Wednesday’s promotion hopes. 
Sam Winnall added a second, on 79 minutes, stooping to head in from five yards after a break up field by sub Adam Reach and a cross from full-back Jack Hunt. 
And Reach gave the scoreline a flattering look three minutes from time when he broke half the length of the field from Winnall’s lay-off before coolly slotting home. 
It took Rhodes just nine minutes of his home debut to continue with Wednesday what he has done everywhere else he has been in his career - scoring. 
It was not the prettiest goal the Scotland international will ever claim but it summed up everything about the 6-foot-plus centre-forward who has made goalscoring at the Championship level look the simplest thing in sport. 
Ross Wallace swung over a free-kick from the right-hand touchline and Rhodes slipped between Paul Robinson and Jonathan Grounds far too easily to force in a header from four yards. Rhodes opened his Owls account in the ninth minute (Photo: Rex Features) He celebrated with his dad - Wednesday's goalkeeping coach - Andy Rhodes (Photo: Rex Features) 
Pretty it may not have been but it was the 173rd league goal of Rhodes’ career - most coming with Huddersfield and Blackburn. 
And on the 299th league start of his career, that marks an incredible strike rate from the 27-year-old who joined Wednesday on deadline day in a loan deal from Middlesbrough. 
That move could be made permanent and eventually cost Wednesday £10 million although if Rhodes has helped shoot them into the Premier League by then, that will be money well spent. 
The Owls certainly looked like a team with promotion on their minds as they tore into Gianfranco Zola’s struggling Birmingham. 
Tomasz Kuszczak blocked early to keep out Sam Winnall, then the keeper fumbled a long shot from Barry Bannan before Grounds booted clear. 
Incredibly, for all their dominance Wednesday almost gifted Birmingham an equaliser with the visitors hitting the woodwork twice in the space of a minute midway through the first half. Sam Winnall made it 2-0 late on... (Photo: Rex Features) ... before Adam Reach scored the Owls' third to seal the victory (Photo: Rex Features) 
First Grounds rose to meet Craig Gardner’s free-kick with a header that shaved the outside of the left-hand post. 
Then, seconds later, Emilio Nsue was left in space in the home area and his left-foot shot thundered against the opposite upright. 
Winnall might have doubled Wednesday's lead before the break with a six-yard shot that was blocked by a defender and, moments after the restart, he placed a shot too close to Kuszczak after great build-up play from Bannon and Wallace. 
There was a timely reminder that the cushion of another goal might be needed when Gardner chanced his arm with a 30-yard strike straight at Keiren Westwood. 
And the Birmingham midfielder, on loan from West Brom, was a lot closer moments later with a free-kick that left the side-netting billowing. 
Wednesday pressed for an all-important second with Winnall nodding over from a corner and an off-balance Rhodes twisting and heading at Kuszczak from another flag kick before Gardner became the third Birmingham player to hit woodwork from 25 yards. 
Birmingham were left to rue Gardner's missed long-range effort as moments later Winnall doubled the Owls' lead before Reach wrapped up all three points. poll loading Will Sheffield Wednesday get promoted this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
